meanings.definition: To lightly touch or tap with the hand.
meanings.sent1: She decided to pat the dog on its head.
meanings.sent2: He likes to pat his pockets to check for his keys.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to pat the rabbit out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: The chef had to pat the dough gently to make the perfect bread.
meanings.sent5: The child learned to pat the clay to make a small bowl.

meanings.definition: A light, gentle stroke with the hand.
meanings.sent1: She gave the dog a pat on the back for being good.
meanings.sent2: He felt comforted by the gentle pat on his shoulder.
meanings.sent3: The cat enjoyed a pat on its head from the owner.
meanings.sent4: The pat on the head made him feel appreciated.
meanings.sent5: A pat on the back can show encouragement and support.

meanings.definition: A small mass of something soft or light.
meanings.sent1: She found a pat of butter on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a pat of flour to the mixture.
meanings.sent3: The artist used a pat of clay to create a small sculpture.
meanings.sent4: A pat of snow fell from the tree branch.
meanings.sent5: He noticed a pat of dust on the old bookshelf.
